Another thing you notice that most torture chambers don't have was a king size bed, only this bed had shackles hooked to the four posters of the bed.
You nearly pass out as you realize this is the 'special guest room'.
The knights pulls you through the door way with a hard tug and the door slams behind you.
12111112.title: "Show her to my special guest room."

121112.content:
You scramble to your feet, asking the first of a dozen questions "Who are you? What is going on? Why..." Eventually you quiet down. Those approaching show no sign that they understand you. [Figures. The ancients often stayed all their lives within a mile of their birthplace. Only the locals spoke the local tongue, and they often spoke no other.] They don't look interested in trying either.

Instead of asking more questions that won't be answered, you look over those approaching. All but one are quickly identified as soldiers of some sort. Their weapons look middle ageist, tho you can only guess if they are utilitarian or for show. [You recall a picture of the Queen of England that had included some ceremonial guards bearing weapons like their's.] The somewhat oldest one of them might be in charge of them.

However, it is the different figure in the center who is clearly in charge of the entire group. The soldiers may surround him, but they still follow the path he is taking.
A noise from behind causes you to look at the dragon, who has adopted a pose which, while not necessarily servile, shows it is aware of the man's approach, and is reacting to it. The man makes no such acknowledgment the dragon is even present. His attention is focused on you, and not in a particularly friendly way.

Physically he is not a particularly impressive individual. Definitely on the far side of 50 and not in prime physical shape, he was rather ordinary. She would have never noticed him in any crowd, if he were wearing clothing she was used to. Now that of course is very much a point. The costume he is wearing is very much the picture of the fantasy wizard, complete with pointed had and long beard. But magicians are impossible, aren't they?
Aren't dragons impossible too?

Magician or not, he is running the show. At a word, two of the soldiers grab you, gently perhaps, but quite firmly. You make a quick attempt to get free, but realize quickly enough that you are going nowhere and subside.
The mage? now does some strange gestures, meaningless to you, and says some words that seem even more meaningless. When he is done, he opens his mouth wide and then points to you, clearly demanding you do the same. When you hesitate to obey, he gestures to another soldier who advances with a weird device, whose function you fear you know. It seems you can surrender with your dignity or without. You choose with, and open your mouth.

Something goes into it, and for a moment you try to spit it out. But at the order "Swallow!", you do so, before realizing you had understood the command.

"Now then. You are the slave of Snarvar here." He gestures at the dragon casually. "You will do as he says and will stay in his quarters." With that, he turns and leaves, as if you are a matter of no importance. Your demand he wait and explain...well anything... is ignored.

With no idea what else to do, you turn to consider your new "master".
121112.title: Magician

1211121.content:
"I got a girl. I got a girl. She's mine." The dragon is practically capering. He is also acting like some nerd, indeed a freshman nerd who had never dared even look at a girl before.
And you realize that is just what he is. He may weigh two tons and have a mouthful of sharp teeth, claws, and a fire breath that can kill, but he is still just a kid, barely big enough to know girls are neat to have around. He's not the captain of the football team or the campus king, not anything close to those huge powerful, self-confident dragons of the stories. He's the little loser that you chased away when he followed you like a puppy. [For a moment you wonder if somehow you have actually fallened into some stupid video game. You should be so lucky. Ignoring other points, any little twerp like this wouldn't be acting like this. He would be doing a bad imitation of a real hero. No, just your luck that this is entirely real, and you are the slave of this little, 4000 lb geek.]

This is just too much. All your terror becomes fury. "You beast! You jerk! You have the nerve to treat me like this!" The dragon is unwise enough to bend its head down to see what was the matter. Your swing of a fist at that huge nose may well have hurt you more than him, but it still feels good to you.
Not to the dragon. It jerks back in shock, confused and wondering what has gone wrong. You are in no mood to stop, and march forward and kick a massive leg. Again, your foot probably hurts worse than any part of the dragon, but it is the dragon who is retreating, almost whimpering "But...but...what's wrong?"

"WHAT'S WRONG?!! You jerk me out of my bed in the middle of the night, carry me off to God knows where, scare me more than half to death, and you're just a kid... What's not wrong?!" As you pause for breath, you realize you have continued to advance on the dragon, which has retreated from your attack until it is positioned much like an overgrown puppy that knows it is about to get a spanking and hopes that big tearful eyes will save it. Fat chance this time. "Now, you take me back to my home, Right Now!"

"But I can't. I don't know how..."

"You brought me here. You can take me back!"

"Now Ma'am, he's right. He doesn't." A new voice. Who? You turn to see one of the soldiers, amused by seeing the puppy take on something 30 times her size, or maybe the standard amusement of any male at the discomfort of another one when dealing with a woman. Either way, he continues "Only Lord Highhat knows that, and He's not about to tell you, as you should know. You are stuck here and will have to make the best of it."
"Just follow Lord Lizard to his quarters. You should find clothing there, not that I am going to object if you don't want to wear it..."
The leer in his voice causes you to look down. You had only been wearing panties and bra when you started this misadventure, and both have suffered during the trip. A quick scream of horror is followed by hands trying to cover entirely too many places, and "You, you big jerk. You take me to those clothes right now!"

A look of fear in his big eyes, the dragon turns and moves at a run, which you deem humiliatingly slow as you run after him to ....
1211121.title: Getting to know each other

12111212.content: How about a large room in the tallest tower, right at the top?
12111212.title: Tallest Tower in the Highest Room

choices: the dragon is watching you dress. (what a perv!)
the dragon is laying in his bed avoiding your wrath.
121112121.content:
The dragon stops infront of a large tower and you nearly run right into him. "What's the matter?" you yell at him, "Why did you stop."
"We're here," he tells you quietly, and points up.
You look around, but there is no enterance around, except for the large window at the top. "How do I...?" but soon you realize that the only way in the dragon's room is to fly in through the hole at the top. "No way! You're not carrying me up there. The way to fly, I'll lose what's left of my clothes."
"But..." the dragon starts.
"You'll carry me on your back!" you order. He bends down and you climb on. You notice that a few of the soldiers are watching. They snicker at the fact that you are ordering the dragon around. The dragon is completely humiliated, but you don't care. it serves him right for kindnapping you.

The dragon takes off and you both quickly arrive at the dragon's room. You don't give him time to let you off. You hop off and look around. The room is very large an it bigger than a few house put together. There isn't that much furniture only two beds, a table, and a dressing corner. One of the beds is larger and just a bunch of pillows that formed a circle on the ground, it is obviously the dragon's.

You rush to the desser and take out some clothes. You don't even see what they look like, and you don't really care. You just want some clothes on you. You are too busy dressing, you forget about the dragon. You turn to see...
121112121.title: The Dragon's Room

1211121211.content:
Like the little boy he is, the dragon is trying to gawk at you while you dress. This will not do at all. Covering as best you can, "You! Turn around and close your eyes!" Reluctantly, the dragon complies. Having had a little experience with boys [You are not sure if it has been too little or too much. It could be both.], you wait, and catch his head turning to sneak a peak. "You keep that head looking away from me until I say so."

Sheepishly, the huge head turns to stare out the window/door. You take a quick look to see if there is any mirror the dragon could be using, but apparently he is not up to that level of sneakiness, at least not yet. So you turn back to dressing as the dragon complains "This isn't what I expected."

"It's not what I expected either, and you at least had a choice about it. So you are just going to have to suffer the consequences of that choice!" As you say this, your hand dives into the dresser to get the rest of your clothing and pulls out ... a duplicate of what you are already wearing...
This is it? This can't be all you are expected to wear. It barely is enough to qualify as the sort of underwear you wear when you want to feel extra-sexy. You can't be expected to run around exposing such a slutty outfit to public view, can you?...
A quick look in all the drawers says that is exactly what is expected. There is a grand total of 3 outfits, the total of which is not enough cloth for a decent dress, much less a full outfit. You might as well be stark naked. Indeed, for a moment, you consider the idea. There can be almost acceptable reasons for not having any clothes on. The only reason for wearing something like ...this... is entirely unacceptable. Are you supposed to be the dragon's sex toy?
You have heard that "one size fits all", but also that there can be too much of a good thing, and you are not saying that any part of that dragon is any good either. But he has got to be too large, among other things. You resist looking to see. It would be horrible if he caught you, and you seem to recall that reptiles keep it out of sight anyway.

Is there anything else you can wear? The sheet from the bed? No, that sounds pretty inviting too. Anything at all? Nothing? You sigh. For now you will just have to resign yourself to looking like something from a porn shoot.
Now is it good or bad news that you look pretty hot in it?

Well, there are more important questions to consider... "Speaking of which, why did you choose me?"
1211121211.title: dressed?

12111212111.content:
"You fit."

"I fit? What does that mean?

The dragon looks embarrassed. "I don't know... I've never seen much of other dragons. I was still in the egg when I came here. So I never learned what that means. But I do know it's important, and that you fit."

This sounds like nonsense. "ridiculous! That has got to be poppycock. I bet this is some sort of weird story that jerk with the high hat fed you to take advantage of you."

"Lord Loy? No. I told him I needed a girl that fit, and he provided the means to find you. That's going to cost me a lot, but I couldn't have found you without his help." Another reason for you not to warm to the crumb. "He said it was going to be a long trip that wouldn't take long, which was confusing, but correct. I didn't know right away that you fit, but it didn't take me long to realize that."

"So I'm the girl that fits, and you have no idea what to do with me? ... And you had better not suggest That idea!"

He doesn't quite abandon it. "But..."

"No! I am not going to be your means to scratch an itch. You go find some girl dragon."

"But you fit, and if not that way, then how?"

"I'm not at all convinced I do fit at all with anyone, and not with you in particular. However, there are bound to be a dozen other ways..." which you had best think of fast. Eventually the dragon is going to realize there is nothing stopping him from just mounting you at his whim. That could take him a very long time, but you are still playing with fire.
"Let me think...
12111212111.title: fitting in

121112121111.content:
You fit? Now what in the world can that mean? Very odd... Hmm...there was something odd about your flight up here...what was it? You can't really recall. Of course, flying on a dragon is odd in and of itself, but there was something...

"Dragon. Lie down."

"Could you call me Snarvar? It is my name?"

You are tempted to say no. Using his name implies a degree of approval, which you do not want to even start to do. Still, it doesn't imply it that hard and you have to get along with this monster, at least for a little while... "Alright, Snarvar, lie down."

He does as told, and you climb onto him, a process hampered by parts of him being downright hot to the touch. Fortunately you move your foot before it gets burned. But most of his hide seems to be pretty much typical leather. It's a bit like alligator and feels like it too .... What was that?
You move your hand back over this one area. No, that is not like alligator, or anything else you can recall. It's quite hard to really describe but it is just different. As you explore to see how big this area is, you realize you can see the difference too. Again, you can't seem to put the difference into words, and in many respects, you can't even say there is a difference, but it is still there.
The area proves quite large before you begin to find the edges, rather precise edges too. It is definitely much longer than wide and as you probe forward with your hands your legs are also fitting into this different area...
Fitting? Quickly you test and verify this is indeed a woman shaped area on the back of the dragon, one of precisely your size. Moreover, you seem to be slightly sinking into the dragon, and the sides are almost grasping you. For a moment, this panics you and you try to get loose, which is absurdly easy. Relaxing, you come back in contact with the area, and are again gripped. But again when you life your hand, it come free.
This some sort of magic velcro? It does sorta act like it. You seem stuck, but can easily get loose.

That's what was so odd about the flight up here. You just should not have been able to hold onto the dragon when it was flying. It was too bumpy and you had too little to hold onto. You should have fallen off ... except that you had fit into this area and it held you to the dragon. That makes sense ... at least as much as anything around here does.

That also explains why there is so little to your clothing. This patch of dragon skin is bonding to your skin, not to the cloth. In a decent outfit, you might fall off. So that is explained, in part. Even with that explanation, it is still half the size it could be, and shameless even by that size. Definitely designed by some perverted male.

So you and the dragon are supposed to be some sort of flying team? You are not sure how you feel about that. For that matter you are not sure the idea is more than speculation. You need to get some more information.
121112121111.title: you do fit

1211121211111.content:
Time to test just how well this magic velcro works. "Snarvar! On your feet!" The dragon does as told, and you stick to the dragon skin as he does. Very good. Of course, it is only a very basic test. "OK, now stand up on your hind legs."

"Hey! You are my slave. You should be obeying me, not ordering me around."

Drat, the dragon is getting his spirit back. Well, it would have happened eventually. So you will just have to deal with it now instead of later. "Tough! You are a boy wanting me to do what I have no intention of doing. If you want me to change my mind, you do as told."

"And why should I care what you want? I'm way bigger than you are. I can just take what I want."

"You do, and I'll find a way to make you regret it. You have to sleep sometime, and even if I can't find a way to kill you, I can still do terrible harm. You want to lose an eye or a wing?"
You wonder how much you are bluffing. You are not sure how vulnerable the dragon is, nor if you can find a weapon in this room. There certainly isn't much in it that is promising. You should be able to find something to use on a vulnerable point, but...
Moreover, you know of a lot of women who have been too brutalized to resist their oppressor. If he beats you often enough, will you still have the nerve to fight him? You certainly can't win anything at all close to a fair fight.
Wait... Maybe he can't use anything like his full strength. He wants you alive after all, and you are so fragile compared to him that he could kill you by accident so easily. That is a real perverted way for you to win, but maybe it will hold him back from attacking. Maybe...
Maybe you had better give him a reason not to attack. "Besides, it is more fun if the girl is willing." More fun for the girl anyway. You wouldn't know about the men, and given their perverted nature, you are not interesting in finding out.

For a moment the dragon is silent, considering your arguments, and you barely can breathe as he makes his decision. Then with a sigh, he gets up on his hind legs and you can go back to finding out how well you stick to the dragon.
Pretty well really. Despite holding onto nothing, and nothing under your feet, you are not falling, or even feeling that you are pushing it. You lift your arms away from the dragon, but there is still no sign you are straining things. For an instant, you consider some Spiderman sort of stunt, but decide not to try it just yet. You did OK in gym, but you weren't even best in class. You can just see any such stunt ending in humiliation.

"What are you trying to do?

"Oh! Well, I have found I can stick to part of your back. I think we are supposed to be some sort of flying team, but before I risk a flight I am trying to make sure I won't fall off.
"Isn't this what you meant by fitting?"

"I don't know. It could be."

Odd the dragon doesn't know. Maybe you should ask him why? But maybe it can wait until after the 1st flight.
1211121211111.title: battle for control

12111212111111.content:
"Well, let's see how fit we are to fly. Out the window with you."

Snarvar does as told, just in time to make academic sudden doubts that you had tested your velcro ability sufficiently. Even as you open your mouth to countermand your orders, the dragon is leaping onto open air and you are desperately try to find something to hang onto, a desperation that increases as the dragon starts to lose altitude...
Then his wings beat, and you are almost slammed into his body, breaking what little hand holds you have. For a second you panic, but then you realize you are still sticking to the dragon. It's working! You are flying!
Boy that was scary at first. But at least you didn't lose your dinner. ... Well, didn't lose it right away ...

You are still green a few moments later when Snarvar asks "Well, now what. You ready to go back?"

"Ye...yes." is your answer and the dragon makes a tight turn. As he does so, you suddenly find yourself enjoying the ride. "Whee! Do that again!"

"But didn't you want to go back?"

"A lady has a right to change her mind. Make a real tight turn again." He shrugs and obeys, a little too well...

You had thought the previous turn was tight. Obviously it was not. This time Snarvar seems to stand on his wingtip, if not flip over entirely. You can see only ground instead of the sky you had been seeing, at least until you bury your head into the dragon hide.

It seems like forever later that you hear "Now what?" The dragon may weigh tons, but you can still hear a little boy proud of himself for pulling off a difficult stunt. You'd tell him off if you hadn't asked for it [or maybe because you had], but you are not sure you can control your stomach while you do. Just as well it is already empty.

Once your have control of yourself, "I..think that's enough for now. Let's go back.."

The dragon is agreeable, and soon the castle is growing in your vision. And your stomach is making itself known, an opinion not shared by your mouth. But maybe it is time to investigate the food conditions here. Or maybe ask the dragon about its history first...
12111212111111.title: first flight

121112121111112.content:
"Snarvar, you say you came here in the egg. How did that happen? Is that common?"

"Huh? Oh, I..well, I am not sure. I have never seen another dragon. I guess it happens a lot. I've heard some of the guards saying a castle is not complete until it has a dragon."

"But don't any of the other castles have a dragon then?"

"Well, we are out in the sticks here. The nearest castle is about a week's flight and I've never been near there."

"Why not? Is it dangerous?"

"Well... Lord Loy doesn't think I should..."

That doesn't really say if it is dangerous or not. Of course, being a boy, he may be scared of admitting he is scared. Probably best not to push, at least when you have other questions.

"But what's your story?"

"Huh?" The dragon has turned the tables on you, and if you are to get the information you need, you are going to have to answer some questions yourself. Well, no reason not to answer. "My name is Kim Johnson. I’m nobody special. I did do well in school, but not that well. My folks were just average folk.” You would just as soon he not pick up on the ‘were’. It’s been a year since the auto accident and the pain has faded to the background, but it is still there and you would just as soon leave it in the background. “I was their only child.”
You pause to consider that there really isn’t anybody who will miss you all that much. No close kin. Not that close of friends. Oh lots who will sorrow, but none who would call you her very best friend. Come to think of it, no enemies either. You had pretty much just been a face in the crowd. Could that have anything to do with why you were the victim of this strange kidnapping? No way to tell at the moment, but maybe it’s a question to ask of this Lord Loy.

But now the castle is close and the dragon is starting to land. There is a delighted cry from the dragon "Dinner's ready!", a cry you are pleased with too, but you still want some answers. Perhaps ask these soldiers who are easy to reach, but may not know? Or go try to bead Lord Loy, who ought to know, but doesn't seem interested in telling you?
121112121111112.title: getting to know you

1211121211111121.content:
The dragon's landing is quicker this time and more direct. You suppose you will have to ask him about that some time, but everything is pretty confusing right now, and you doubt you would understand the answer. Besides, there is dinner to consider at the moment, not to mention more basic questions.

Dinner for the dragon proves to be a pile of meat, about as large as you are [a distinctly unsettling thought]. As the dragon starts to eat with a fair degree of gusto, you are handed a bowl of what looks to be stew. At home you would have debated between throwing it out, or leaving it in the back of the fridge to age a bit first. Still, you have eaten worse when the alternative was actually doing the cooking. It at least proves no worse than you feared.

As you pick at it, you notice the serving woman is sitting down to her bowl and attacking it with a good deal more enthusiasm than you are. From her figure, you seriously doubt she is at all starving, but none of that stew is going to be wasted. Waisted, quite possibly. But she is definitely enjoying it.
As she finishes and leans back to relax, you decide it is time to start asking some of those questions. "I am Kim, Kim Johnson. Can I have you name?

She turns a friendly face towards you "I'm Wigana. You gettin long with mi little lad?"

"Your lad?"

"Did most of the raisin of him, if you please. More of a mom ta him than his mom was. He's gotten grown up now and bout all I can do these days is help with the feedin."

"Oh...well, I guess..."

"Hear tell ya put him in his place. That's likely a good thing. Lad was gettin a bit big for his britches of late. But mind you, don't you hurt my little boy."

You are not sure you can, but... "I won't, but what is going on? Why have I been brought here?"

"Now that I can't say. And I'm not so sure anybody else can either.
"Ya see. Lord Loy, he's the ruler here, he's somethin of a vision mage. He can see ta future, but not too often and not too clearly.
"Ya can tell when's he's had a vision. He gets all quiet and gloomy fer a few days. Then he starts givin all sorts of orders. Lots of them don't make any sense, but he won't have it any other way, and he's ta lord. And he won't explain neither. Tryin ta pretend he knows more than he does if ya asks me.
"But we's can usually guess just how much he knows, and with Snarvie, he's actin like he knows lots more than he does. He's sure the dragon's very important, but probably not much else."

You are tempted to tell her that seeing the future is impossible, but then so are dragons flying around. And you recall a poly sic prof who told you that if the man with the gun said he was a god, it was a very bad idea to tell him he wasn't. So to more practical points...
Try to see Lord Loy? He has to know a lot you need to know even if he doesn't know all you want. Or just keep talking with Wigana? She knows a fair amount, even if it is not the big picture.
1211121211111121.title: dinner companion

12111212111111212.content:
"But why does this castle need a dragon? It must be expensive to keep."

Wigama looks at you like you had asked why does 2+2=4. "A castle's not complete without a dragon. Ta's just the way things is."

You press on. "But why? What does the dragon do?"

Wigana admits "Well, I don't really know. Tain't my place fer one thing. But ta Lord, he may not be as smart as he thinks he is, but he's still a pretty bright guy, and he really wanted that dragon. Paid a lot of gold fer that egg. That's good nuff fer me, and should be fer you too."
Seeing you are not convinced, she adds "One thing I do know is we ain't been attacked since that egg hatched. We had ta suffer several sieges fer that, but none since. Now I can't say it had anything to do with it. Maybe Lord Loy just ran out of enemies. Maybe...whatever. But we've had a pretty good span of peace and I figure feedin ta dragon a couple of cows is a small price ta pay fer that."

"But you have no idea what I am here for and what I am to do?"

"Well, I've heard that every dragon needs a rider. But I don't knows if them that say that knows anything, and I certainly don't know why. Could be ya just looks nice riddin round on it.
"Now I does know th lad's been pining for somethin for some time. Been actin lot like my sons when they started feelin ta urge. And there ain't no female dragons round here far as we know."

You recall some of the dragon's behavior with you. "I am not going to be his sexual toy!"

"Suppose we really ought ta marry ta two of you, if that's ta idea. But it's early on ta be makin plans like that. Til we does know better, yer probably right. Never have met a man who didn't treat his woman better for her having said no ta him til he got serious bout marriage.
"But ya really should consider the bright spots. Ta lad's a pretty good sort. Better than a lot of men round here, if ya asks me." [Given she is his "mother", you are not convinced by her claim.] "Ya could do a lot worse. That's sure. And ya probably will do durn well."

Fortunately, you don't need to answer. The dragon is done with dinner and Wigana must get to work with the cleanup. But you still don't have any answers, just more worries. Now the dragon seems to to want to fly back to his room, where you would be alone with him, a distinctly disquieting prospect, given what Wigana just said. Still, you have been able to control him so far, and he may be able to tell you more about what is going on here. But maybe it is time to demand Lord Loy tell you something...
12111212111111212.title: Wigana

121112121111112121.content:
"Perhaps I should talk to Lord Loy and find out what he thinks he is doing."

"Good luck with that. His lordship keeps his plans ta himself. But I suppose ya might as well try. Tain't gonna hurt.
"Course, ya gotta waits til Morning. Tis already late."

With a bit of shock, you realize it is almost dark. You almost make a remark about time to turn on the lights, but then you recall where you are. There are no electrical lights here. Not even any gas ones. These people are ruled by the Sun. They rise at first light and stop when it gets dark.
And now it is getting dark. The day is done. That means next on the calendar is sleeping. As far as you are concerned, it is hours early, but you have no choice in the matter. On this at least, you will just have to adjust.

Well, off to your room. Fortunately Snarvar makes no trouble. He has likely had a harder day than you have and could easily be quite tired. Not that you are sympathetic since most of that energy was used to kidnap you, but at least he is not objecting to you giving the orders despite being considered his slave and being outweighed about 20-1 or more.

You seem to be adjusting to flight quickly tho. Of course it is just a little hop, but you do have a full belly and you were rather sensitive earlier. But this time, you don't even feel a bit of distress. One good thing at least.

Getting off the dragon, you now have to consider the problem of getting ready for bed without that "little" pervert watching. You consider again ordering him not to look, but you are just not going to get much privacy with him in the same room no matter what you do. You will just have to crawl under the covers and remove your clothing the...
Covers? What covers? Or blankets? The bed has nothing but a sheet! But,.. but... Well, there is nothing to be done about it. At least it is not transparent. So under it you go.
As you had expected, you do not fall asleep quickly. [Besides your not being sleepy, the dragon snores, loudly.] You try considering your predicament, but without really making much progress in what you should do. Eventually sleep does come.

Briefly it seems. You wake, shivering. The room is downright cold, and you have no clothing worth mentioning, and a sheet that is almost worthless as insulation. Maybe it's not cold enough to kill you, but it is getting cold enough that you are not sure that death would be a bad thing. You can't even stop your teeth from chattering.

Was the dragon waiting for that? Or does he just have excellent hearing? In any case, Snarvar asks "Cold? Come to my bed and I can warm you up." You can hear the delight in his voice. He is going to get a free feel out of this, if not a good deal more.
But the dragon is warm, hot even. And you are in a very cold room, effectively naked for all the good what little cloth you have is doing. OK, he is not going to be a complete gentleman, but surely you can stop him from being too improper. And it is really cold...
But you can see where that is going to lead, and that is not going to happen if you have anything to say about it.
But you are going to lose any war with the dragon. Surely you can be friends without .. well, things getting out of hand. Can't you?
But...
Well, you had best stop considering the offer and answer. All you are doing by thinking is getting colder.
121112121111112121.title: Bedtime

1211121211111121211.content:
The dragon is so much bigger than you, and you can't hide or escape the room. So it's really not any different whether you are in the same bed or not. You are at his mercy either way. And you will be warm...
You try not to remember that both of you think the difference is important, which means it is important. You aren't fully successful at this. But it is still cold, quite cold enough for you to try again, and decide that, with proper discouragement, he won't get out of line..., at least not too far...

"You promise to behave yourself? No touching?"

"You are going to be in bed with me. How can I avoid touching you?"

"You know what I mean! There is touching and there is touching, and you are not to touch." It sounds a bit strange in a way. Here he is offering you a favor, and you are the one objecting. However, neither of you doubt that he is the one getting the best of the deal.

"OK, OK, I promise, no touching."

Next problem where you seem to lose either way. You don't want to rush into his [warm] arms. That might give the wrong impression. But if you hesitate, you are hinting you are aware of that aspect, and still being willing. That doesn't sound good either.
In the end, the cold decides for you and you rush to that warm dragon bed. The consequences may be dire, and not far away either, but you can't think of anything but getting to that heat and you are hugging that gigantic beast as hard as you can, and welcoming that arm that curves around you and warms your back.

It doesn't take too long to warm up enough to become rational again, but that is too late. You are either doomed or in no great danger. Either way, trying to escape isn't going to help. And the cold is waiting...

"Come on. Let's get some sleep." [Now if he will just let you...]

"What a dream," Snarvar thought, moving his free hand down to his sex, feeling it exposed and eager to please, "Her scent must really be getting to me. "What?" Kim asked.

You feel the dragon "letting go" of you. Just how a patch of skin and scales could have held onto you in the first place is a mystery, but somehow he was doing it. For the moment, you are just happy you felt the change in time to land on your feet.
But this increased bond between you will need to be explored. If nothing else, it may mean you can finally wear some decent clothing and not have to worry about falling off. [A voice in the back of your mind hints you are not going to be so lucky.] So there will have to be some testing on the ground and in the air. So to start...

Snarvar looks superior, and then confused "Why bonding is ... It's ... Well, I know it happened, and it's important, very important."

So it is something beside just this magic velcro. But just what? You recall reading that baby birds will bond to whatever creature they see at hatching as their mother. Has the dragon bonded with the first female he slept with? Are you now his wife? or fiance? You suppose that is better than being his lust toy, but it is not something you are going to approve of. You didn't bond with him
....did you?
Are you taking this situation a little too calmly? Shouldn't you be hysterical? Or catonic? Shouldn't you be horrified by the very idea of sex with this monster? That sort of bestiality is surely something you would never do. [You shut down the sudden memory of that wonderful horse ride and of your wish he could have talked and said some very romantic things.]
But you have always been a pretty practical lass, ready to roll with the punches, so you don't really think you are behaving differently than you would have predicted. Besides, you were not behaving that differently yesterday ... or were you?

There are some scary implications, and you are not sure you want to explore them, at least not just yet. For now, maybe it is better to check on how much your ability to stick to the dragon has increased. Or maybe it is time for breakfast...

121112121111112121121112.content:
Breakfast can wait. Right now you want to find just how bonded you are to the dragon. In particular, whether you can get some decent [well, maybe just a little indecent...] clothing instead of this slutty trash.

"Snarvar, hold still a moment." When he does, you climb onto him. You are careful not to look for foot or hand holds. Instead, you just touch him as if you expect to stick to where you touch. A totally silly notion, ... which works quite well. It is no more trouble than a set of steep stairs. Soon you are standing on his back. So far so good. Now for some stupid stunts. ...
You jump, and stop where you land. No slide. No slip. Now you make a longer and harder jump and land on your feet ... and then flat on your face. This sticking is not all good then. Still, it is good to know you are not letting go until you want to.
OK, try a roll ... Pretty good. You roll until you want to stop, and suddenly you are sticking to the dragon again.
Now that real sticky spot ... Yes, it is even more gripping now, but it still releases at will. So why is it there if you can stick anywhere? ... Maybe that means the grip on the rest of the dragon may not be adequate for some flying. Or maybe ... Well, you will have to test that somehow, but later.
Now for clothing. You scramble down and grab the sheet from your bed. Way too thin to be of much use as a protection against cold, and frankly too thin to really qualify as clothing either. You can see right thru it. Wearing this, you still feel like a slut. Still, it may do as a test...
Back to the dragon and you climb up ... and slide right back to the floor. You try again, and get to his back only after struggling all the way. Over to the sticky spot. ... Well, at least this is still sticky, but it's not nearly as strong.
Does this mean this entirely inadequate outfit is all you can wear? If so, that seems to be proof that there is a god, and that He is a loutish male with no respect for a woman's privacy!

Well, you are not going to give up yet, but ...

"Kim, it's breakfast time. Let's fly down."

"OK" Toss the sheet and get into the fitting area. It seems now you can fly down on tiptoes without risk, but only a boy would take such a risk. "Let's go."

It was only when you are in the air that you remember that he called you "Kim". When did you tell him your name? It's a casual thing. Surely you just forgot it, or maybe he heard when you introduced yourself to his "mother". Or maybe this bonding means something... That's a rather scary thought.

Well, it will have to wait until after breakfast, and you should learn something then. Tho that will likely just add a dozen more questions.

Breakfast is a surprisingly big meal, bringing fears you may get fat on such a diet. Of course, the locals don't seem to sit around much, so maybe you will get enough exercise to burn off the calories.

Now to see if this Lord Loy will answer any of your questions. You head for the door, only to be blocked by the guards. The important looking one tells you "Lord Loy's orders. You are to return to the dragon with me."
Your protests are ignored, and somewhat half-hearted anyway. The attitude of this guard suggest something is up and so some of your questions will be answered soon enough anyway. You try asking anyway as the two of you head to Snarvar, who has finished his meal too, and get the unencouraging "Lord Loy will explain when he feels the time is right."
He does unbend enough to say "His Mageship does not ask my advice or explain things to me. There have been times he could have benefited from doing so, but he has been right a much greater number of times. So I hear and obey, and you will be wise to do the same. [Advice you don't plan on taking if you have anything to say about it. Of course, it is not clear you do.]

Once he has the dragon's attention, the guard takes off a belt pouch and hands it to you. As you strap it on you, trying to find some way it covers a little of you, the guard announces "This is to be delivered to Lord Tangye. It will likely take you all day to get there. So you presumably will stay the night before returning on the morrow."

"And how do we get there?" The answer sounds terribly complicated and confusing. It is repeated upon request, but sounds little clearer. Snarvar insists he can follow the directions, tho he admits to having never been there. Your protest that there must be easier directions is rejected and you are told to be on your way.
Well, Snarvar is eager to go, and so you see little choice but to climb aboard and .. fall down when the dragon immediately jumps into the sky. That bond can come in handy it seems. You would have fallen right off the dragon without that connection. Of course, about the time you figure this out, you are 100 feet up in the air and with nothing but the bond keeping you on the dragon. Not a good situation, but at least your terror is keeping your stomach quiet.
Getting to the stop where you "fit", and stick harder, sounds like the best plan and you carefully crawl to it, being careful not to pull too much of you away from the dragon. Finally you make it, and feel a grip on you that seems as strong as steel. You can relax a little.

Which reminds you. Is Snarvar following the directions? It seems so and he confidently recites what sounds like the directions. So you wonder if this is your purpose here, to be a showy and fast messenger? Seems rather inefficient to you, but maybe it works.

As time passes, you grow more relaxed, and begin to stop trying to burrow into Snarvar's skin. Indeed, you start raising yourself enough to look around and get comfortable. You wonder if eventually you will be standing straight up for the better view. Not this time anyway, but you are beginning to think your bond is that strong.

But as the hours pass, you begin to worry. You can't be sure, but you feel lost. Were the directions wrong? Did you miss one? Take the wrong direction somewhere? Snarvar is still confident, but you try suggesting he stop for directions. Typical male, he insist he knows where he is going, and there is really little you can do but be a worried passenger.

"Now I don't know how seriously, but by the laws of dragons Snarvar and Meia, and thus their riders, are criminal births. Their eggs should not have been laid or allowed to hatch, or... Anyway, their continued existence is a crime, and you may be killed on sight by any other dragon you might encounter.
"Or you might be welcomed and treated well. Or nearly anything in between. The laws of dragons are complex, if not outright contradictory and I am at best a novice in studying them. I can make no promises. All I can really do is warn you to take care."

"Meia's case, we are most familiar with. We were under siege by another dragon, which was slowly killing and eating us. She appeared and killed it. Then she demanded that as a reward, we hatch and raise her egg. We knew this to be a common scenario. A dragon does a great favor, but demands an egg be raised as a reward. The reason is that the egg would not survive otherwise due to the actions of other dragons. There are many variations to the tale from there, but the egg is rarely refused. One both owes the dragon and fears it. But one must hide the egg from other dragons who deem this a crime that endangers their own children. We were not unusual in our response and Meia is the happy result.

"Snarvar's case is of course less known to me, but I hear of many dragons who sell eggs to humans and other races. Presumably Snarvar was one of those eggs. I do know that many institutions deem themselves horribly handicapted if they do not have such a dragon.

"Some eggs are simply hiddened with enough food to allow the child to survive until it can hunt. Such, if they survive, become wild animals, who frequently kill people and are killed by people. There are many heroic tales of their battles.

"Dragons tolerate these and some other means of cheating. They have to because their ability to eliminate it is limited. But they do make efforts to some extent. The number of dragons needs to be controlled, or they end up killing each other. Every other dragon is a problem, and a possible solution is killing you. I can hope that won't happen, but I can't guarantee it.

"Yes, and some very strange things happened there." Quickly you run down your encounter with the ghost and the rest of what you found.

"Then you may find the tale very informative.

Katherine proposed that all eggs be placed under the care of the most worthy dragon who would raise just one from each clutch of eggs, assuring all dragons a share and that a child of theirs would be raised.

"The other dragons and dragon riders were not enthused and it took a long time with much struggle before all would agree. It was almost as long a struggle to select who would raise these eggs. My eggs need to be watched over, and my belly needs to be filled. You can solve at least one of those problems. You gulp. "Aren't I a bit small for you?" Yes, but your meat would keep me full for months if I go into a hibernative state. I would prefer to have you as an egg-sitter, than as a meal though, so I will let you choose.
1243.title: The sisters

12433.content:
"Well, I don't have much of a choice," you say disdainfully,"I'll watch your eggs for you." Good choice, for both of us. Mayla turned to the other dragons. These two are my sisters. The blue-green one is Shura and the red one is Taklu. "Nice to meet you, Shura and Taklu." Taklu grunted in irratation and flew out of the cave. "Did I do something wrong?" No, dear, Taklu is always grumpy, a new, soft voice cooed. Shura was looking at you curiously. Her eyes sparkled as she came in close to look you over. I've never seen a human up so close, at least not one I wasn't killing. You start to sweat. No worries, dear, your safe. Besides being Mayla's egg-sitter, I only kill humans you get too close to my nest or see me. I can't have them going out to tell their friends there's a dragon in the forest. "That's kind of harsh, isn't it?" Now Mayla spoke. Maybe it is, but secrecy is our best defense. You should know, humans respond to the unknown with violence and destruction. We'd be driven to extinction. You nod in reluctant agreement. Well, I'm feeling that pang in my gut. I saw a herd of white-tailed deer near my lake, and I should get them before they move on. Goodbye sister, goodbye Kim. Shura dove backwards out of the cave and twisted into flying position.

Show off, Mayla snorted, a small puff of smoke escaping her nostrils. Mayla turned her attention to Kim. I'm going to teach you about how to care for my eggs. "Okay then," you reply. You follow her to a room attached to what would be her bedroom. In it was a much smaller, but deeper depression, as well as lot's of "Wood?," you ask. Yes, wood. As you probably know, eggs have to be kept warm. Dragon eggs are no exception, but they have to be kept exremely warm. The wood is fuel for fire. "We have to cook the eggs?," Mayla snorted. In a way. the fire will burn over and around the eggs to keep them nice and hot while they incubate. You just need to keep the fire burning while I'm gone. "That reminds me, I have a question" Yes? "Well, why do you need me at all? I'm sure you or your sisters could place wood on the fire as well as I can. Mayla hung her head slightly. Normally, dragons care for there young as a pair. One hunts while the other tends to the eggs, or young when they hatch, and they take turns doing each. But my mate left me. Mayla roared and whipped the cave wall with her tail. He abandoned his family, his mate for 24 years, for some new fling! Mayla pounded the ground, making the cave shake. You fall on the ground and curl into a defensice ball. The shuddering stops. You look up to find Mayla curled up like a cat on the floor. Her body shakes rythmically. You realize with a shock she is crying. You come around to her head and stroke the ridge above her eyes. She looks at you with light grey eyes sparkling with unshed tears. Thank you, Kim. I think I'm going to like having you around.

124331.content:
Mayla straightened up and turned away from the nest. Well, now is as good a time as any. My eggs are ready to lay. Mayla looked at Kim. Um, Kim? "Yes, Maylu?" Could you...you know... "What?", you ask, trying to decipher her strange tone. Well, I don't really feel...comfortable wtih you watching me. "Oh, of course, I'll just..." You stop mid-sentence. There's really nowhere to go except out into the open air. Suddenly, an aqua-colored blur whizzes past the cave entrance, knocking you on your butt from the wind. Shura loops around and lands on the cave edge. Come on, Kim, let's give Mayla some privacy. You prepare to be grabbed by a dragon paw, but instead, Shura extends her neck across the floor. Hop on Shura! Have you no dignity! this voice was harsh, deep, and angry. The red dragon, Taklu, landed beside Shura and growled at her. It's bad enough having a human in a nest, but letting it ride you like a common beast! Shura was calm and stepped between you and Taklu. I have plenty of dignity, Taklu, but I also have plenty of kindness. This girl has been through a lot today, and has a lot to deal with in the coming months. I thought a peaceful ride in the sky would help solidify her trust in us and reward her for her service. Taklu growled with disagreement, but said nothing. She turned to leave, and as she did, you saw trio of long scars along her underside. Each line was as wide as your hand and went along her belly from her front legs to the base of her tail. You gasp when you see them. Taklu left hurridley, and Shura visibly relaxed. Poor thing, so distrustful of everyone and everything "What happened to her, her scars?" Mayla shifted to lay down. Her mate kept her against her will. Had her since she was little. He didn't count on how strong she would become, though. One day, when he mounted her, she turned on him. I don't know the details, but it ended with her bloodied and free and him dead. Whatever, we won't let her ruin our day. Come on, Kim, I have some things to show you. You climb onto Shura's neck, thankful she doesn't have spikes like Taklu, and grip the sided of her neck. Hold on tight! Shura leaps into the air, wings folded in.

The two of you free fall down the mountain side. The wind rushing over makes it tought to hold on, but you do. Less than a hundred feet from the ground, Shura's wings extend and she swoops up, flappin until she's level with the cave again. Having fun! "Uh, sort of! Can we not do that, I almost lost my grip!" Well, I guess. Her disapointment is temporary. Would you like to see my home? "Sure,I'd love to," you agree. Shura turns sharply and begins to dive, much slower this time, towards a bean-shaped lake at the base of the mountains. She hovers above the middle of the lake. Hold your breath. You suck in as much air as possible. She dives into the lake, swimming down towards a faint glow. The glow comes from an underwater cave system, which she enters. Your breath is almost gone when she emerges into a large cave. Welcome to my secret cave. The cavern is oddly beautiful. The light comes from the ceiling, and it's aqua color adds to the peaceful mood. "Why is the light that color?" Shura looks up to the ceiling. A few enchanted quartz crystals. Creates a nice mood, don't you agree. You give her a quizzical look. "Enchanted? You mean, like, Magic" Yep. A few dragons can use magic to some degree. I can manipulate certain forms of energy, especially light and elctricity. You gaze at her with awe. "That's amazing!" Well, it's really nothing. Just a neat little trick. She turns her head away as she says this. She's obviously flattered at your praise. Well, what should we do now?

1243312.content:
"Maybe we could go back to Mayla's nest?", you suggest. Okay. Mayla is probably done laying by now. You climb back onto Shura's neck. She leaps up and dives into the water. Once again, your almost out of breath when she breaks the surface and is flying. Your a calm one, you know that, Kim? "Really?" Yeah. Most of your kind panics or faints when we descend on them, but you barely flinched. You think about her compliment. "Well, I've read about dragon's, and always wanted to meet one," you tell her,"I didn't think it would be so easy!" Shura laughs at that. It's so great to talk with a new person! Mayla is great, but she's not really the fun-loving type, and Taklu...well, you've seen her. I'm glad we decided to hold on to that necklace. You grasp the dragob-tooth pendant on the necklace. "I'm guessin this is what let's me talk with you?" That's right. It has other properties, too, but I've only figured out some of them. "Like, what?" you ask, curious about the magical necklace that let's her talk to dragon's. It contains a great deal of knowledge and power relating to dragons. When you don't kow what to do or lack the power to do so, it will help you. "Wait, how can you not know all of it's properties? Didn't you make it?" Nope, I didn't. Taklu brought it with her when she came to us. See, Taklu's not our sister by blood, but by bond. We irritate each other, but we all love each other just the same. I would give my life to protect them, as they would for me. Shura was so wrapped up in talking she almost flew right into a flock of mirating geese. Many angry honks and growls were exchanged. Stupid geese, only dragons should fly this high in the air. Anyway, Taklu's mate, if you could call him that, apparentley had that necklace in his possesion, and Taklu took it when she left. You take another look at the pendant. "Maybe I shouldn't wear this, it is Taklu's." Nah, it's fine, besides, I don't think it will fit around her neck.

They arrived back at the cave to find Mayla sleeping peacefully. She must be worn out from laying. "Is it difficult?" you ask. Shura looks you up and down. For you, it would be like passing rocks the size of your fist through your...what do humans call it...vagina. You make a fist. Small as your hand is, you shudder just thinking about it. "So, where are her eggs?" Shura sniffed. In the room she showed you earlier. The two of you head to the room, the nursery, you decide to call it, to find a large fire. And in the fire, stark white against the red and orange of the fire, are five large eggs. Five, a good clutch, not too big, not too small. You admire the egg nearest you. It's shaped a lot like an ostrich egg, and similarly colored, but much larger, as large as a bean bag chair. "So these are what I'm going to be keepin an eye on?" That's right, Kim. Mayla had woken up and was standing near her, gazing at her eggs. "How long do they take to hatch?", you ask, wanting to find out how long your sentence here will be. It should take about 6 months to hatch and another 18 after that until they can leave the nest. Your in for quite a stay, Kim. Your stunned. Just when your starting to like these dragons, you find out you'll be here for 2 full years! "WHAT! I have a life to live, I can't be stuck her for two...", your tirade is interrupted when Mayla picks you up and slams you into the wall, pinning you against it. Don't forget, human, you only live as long as you do as your told. I can be a kind mistress, or a cruel predator. Remember that.
1243312.title: Mayla's eggs

12433122.content:
You eyes flicker open to the blinding sunlight peeking over the far off mountians. You stretch and haul yourself out of bed. Your 'bed' was really just a pile of soft animal furs, but it was warm and comfortable. You adjusted your patched clothing and looked yourself in the mirror, a large shard of a mirror Shura had scavenged from a dump over the mountains. You may not have seen a human for 6 months, but you still liked to look nice, if only for your own eyes. Your eyes were bright and alert, your hair, long and a little dirty, but pretty. Your skin, slightly scratched, but otherwise a flawless pale tan. Over the last half a year, constant activity and a reduced, more natural mealplan had stripped the fat from your body and left a layer of toned, sleek muscle in it's place.

Oh, yeah, and you were turning into a dragon.

It was subtle at first, your nails were a little too thick, your eyes unusually bright, your clothes a bit ill-fitting. It soon became obvious what was happening, though. Shura had been testing the necklace and found it's primary enchantment was to transform the wearer into a dragon. It's first effect was on the mind, which was what gave you the ability to understand them. You had worn it so much, though, the weakened magic was working on your whole body. Your nails had thickened and spread to the entire front of your fingers and toes, forming thick claws. Your feet extended backwards until your legs had an extra joint, like a big cat's or, rather, like the other dragon's. Scales, a deep, rich violet, spread from your hands to your elbows, with a ridge along the outside of your arm. Your legs also had scales up to your first joint, and a small, horn-like spur grew from it. You pulled back your hair to see your ears. They were now pointed and tough. Tiny scales, almost like freckles, dotted your cheeks. Your eyes were slitted and purple. You smiled. Your teeth were sharper and my fangs longer. You even felt the ridge of your spine growing denser.

You smiled wider. You could have removed the necklace at any time, and stopped this transformation. Something deep in me, though, wouldn't let me. A realization of a fantasy you'd had since you were little. So you'd let myself go down this path and see where it took you.

As you finished looking over yourself, a whoosh and thud told you Mayla was back from hunting. Morning, Kim. "Morning, Mayla. How was hunting?" Fair enough. I caught a pair of wolves. "Your eggs have been active. Do you think they'll hatch soon?" They may hatch today. I can smell the young inside. They are ready. "Really!" I ran into the nursery. Mayla was already there. It's time. She let out a voluminous wave of flame over the eggs. That seemed to be the catalyst. The eggs started wiggling, and before long, a crack appeared in the egg nearest to you. Help them out. You scales will protect you. You didn't hesitate. You griped the edge of the cracked shell and pulled it out. A long, scaly arm shot out and nearly maimed you. The chick worked it's way out of the egg the rest of the way by itself. The other chicks were also hatching, and Mayla was helping them. Soon, a menagerie of four dragon chicks stood, or lay, around you and Mayla. "What about that one?" you asked, pointing at the one unhatched egg. I sense nothing. No beat, no movement. That one is lost. She started to roll it to the edge of the cave andit was obvious she intended to toss it out. "Wait! Don't! You can't just abandon it!" I can. It is dead.

You newfound, dragon-enhanced strength allowed you to wrest it away from her and you shattered the shell with your claws and fists. A pale green dragon head flopped, lifeless, into your lap. You started to cry and hugged the small head. You'd spent 6 months looking after these eggs alongside Mayla. You felt like a mother losing a child. I know it hurts, Kim. It hurts me, too. I didn't expect this many to survive to hatchday. Let it go

choices: The chicks grow under their mothers's care

124331222.content:
You didn't want to let it go. This...beautiful creature. So innocent, and it didn't even get to see it's first day. "Please...please wake up, little one." As you stroked the dead head, you gelt...something. A huge rush of energy. You felt alert, strong, like you had all the energy of a dragon coursing through your small body. Your claws glowed with pale blue light, and Mayla retreated. What the...where is this magic... The light from your claws receded, only to reappear in the scales of the dead chick. After glowing like a lantern for a few moments, the chick began to stir. "It's alive!" You cried. You hugged the chick to your chest. It cooed and licked your face. It's tongue was rough, but it tickled more than hurt. "He's beautfiul." She, acutally. What could have done this... "I don't really care right now! She's alive!" The edges of Mayla's lips curled in a rough imitation of a smile. Yes, she's alive. Now, why don't you give her a name? You looked over at Mayla. "But, she's your daughter." Biologically, yes, but look. She likes you much more. The chick was all over you, cuddling up against you like a cat. "Well, if your okay with it..." I have 4 others to worry about. Not to sound cruel, it will be relief to have one being cared for by you. The 4 others in question were crowded around Mayla's legs, cooing up at her. Okay, little ones, dinner is served. Mayla's head jerked forward several times, then she regurgitated a mostly whole wolf. The chicks quickly tore into the carcass. The green chick in your lap looked up at you pleadingly. "Um...Mayla?" Yes? "She's hungry, and I don't....or can't..." Mayla nodded and tore a leg off the wolf and tossed it to my chick. She cooed in thanks and ate. I noticed she was much slower, less ravenous than her kin. You stroked her neck as she ate and eanred a friendly sounding growl from her. "Hmm, she's a beauty. I'll call you...Keiko." Keiko...I like that. What does it mean? "It's Japanese. It means, if I remember right, adored one." Fitting. Still, I wonder how she is even alive. You remembered what Shura had told you on the first day you'd been kidnapped by the dragon sisters. It contains a great deal of knowledge and power relating to dragons. When you don't kow what to do or lack the power to do so, it will help you You palmed the amulet and gripped it. "I think this amulet gave me the power to save her." Mayla looked down at the amulet. Perhaps. In any case, the chicks need to rest. Hatching is strenous ordeal. Mayla called her chicks to her and curled up with them in her "bed". However, Keiko stayed with you. "Okay, Keiko, let's get some shut eye." You carried her, finding she was suprisingly light despite being over 4 feet long, and curled up with her on the bed of furs

You had a curious dream. In it, you were walking through a thick forest of tall, tropical trees, strange plants, and swooping vines. There were no animals, but you kept seeing a green blur streak in the shadows. You wandered through the forest, trying to follow the mysterious shape through the undergrowth. But as you followed it, the forest got thivker and thicker until you reached a clearing, where the trees themselves seemed to be closing in around you. Then, the blur started circling the clearing, spiraling in towards you. It slowed until you saw the shape of a dragon. A small dragon. It was Keiko. You smiled and reached out to stroke her head. She responded to your touch and licked your hand. Suddenly, though, she bit you! You instinctively retracted your hand to suck on the wound, but when your finger went into your mouth, you tasted...something. Soft and rubbery. You looked at your hand. A small, weed-like flower was growing out of your finger! You picked it out, but it regrew, and grew, and grew. Vines creeped up your arm and snaked down your torso. Your whole body was being bound in a green cocoon! As the vines engulfed your face, your last sight was of Keiko, looking at you with pleading eyes...

You awoke suddenly in a cold sweat. Keiko stirred next to you, but didn't wake. You pulled on a fur coat made of a few smaller pelts sewn together. It was night, but the moon was full, giving plenty of light to see. You didn't want to sleep, not after that nightmare. Bad dreams, Kim? Shura swooped in and landed next you. "I had a strange nightmare. I was chasing a strange, green shape through a forest, and when I caught it in a clearing, it was Keiko." Keiko? "Didn't you know? Mayla's eggs hatched!" Really! That's wonderful! "Yes, 4 of the eggs hatched, but the last..." That's a shame. "But it wasn't! I cracked open the egg and pulled out the dead chick. I held it and begged for it to come back to life, and she did!" Amazing... "I know. I think it was the amulet." Shura looked over at Keiko. To come back from the dead...that's powerful magic. She is a blessed dragon. "Yeah,she's a miracle." Not just that. I sense powerful magic about her. You looked over at the sleeping chick. She stirred slightly, whimpering. She misses her mother. "Mayla said I should care for her. Does that mean..." I think Keiko sees you as her mother. It's a rare thing for a dragon to imprint on any but it's true mother, let alone on a human. You must be a wonderful person, Kim. You smiled and scratched Shura's chin. "I'm glad you three kidnapped me. This is much more interesting than my old life." Shura nuzzled you gently. Well, you've managed to grow on me as well, Kim. I'll be sad to see you go.
